metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10920 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Improper input validation bug in DNS resolver component of Knot Resolver before 2.4.1 allows remote attacker to poison cache.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10920` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

knot-resolver - 3.2.1-3ubuntu2
knot-resolver-module-http - 3.2.1-3ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: knot-resolver package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.1-3ubuntu2').
